title: Current Bond Holdings
text:
Age nearly 61, still working for a few more years. Our bond holdings are down to about 5% of our portfolio, about 18% is cash (MMA). Rest is equity. Contributing pretty heavily to savings during final few years of work.

I’m in a similar mindset as you, lack of yield leads me to not “lock away” money for pitiful yields, I’d just rather build cash for now. I’d love to move more of our cash into bonds, but yields are causing me to hold off for now. Just “dribbling” money into bond funds for now- $5000 per month. Our bond funds are as follows:

25% VWALX/ 50% VWIUX/ 25% VMLUX (for house we’re building) is in our taxable accounts (majority of our bond money)

50% VBILX/ 50% VEMBX (Emerg Mts. Bond)/ VTABX (Intl bonds)/ VWEAX (high yield) in two ROTH accounts

VICSX in 401-K/ IRA accounts

VBIAX (~40% bonds) and VWELX (~30% bonds) in our two ROTH 401-K’s.

Hoping yields start trending up over next 1-2 years, but right now that looks unlikely. At least in cash, I stay “flexible” and can move it (slowly) to bonds. Plus, the yields on bonds are not much higher than good MMA’s right now.

Win
description: Currently my bond holdings are down to about 9% of my holdings and that 9% is invested in a 0-5 Year maturity EFT. My reasons are lack of yield. I - 19381
